Description: An ivory bangle: slightly oval in shape, broken into many pieces. The outer face is convex, the inner straight.
Curator's comments: This and bangles 1929,1015.221; 1929,1015.224 & 1929,1014.226 were all worn on the same arm. Also from this burial: bangle with knobs (1929,1015.223). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 40, 53; pl. XXV, 10; Grave register, pl. IX.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (11)
